title: Avoid duplicated signatures when building transactions (backport #4230)

labels.name: merge
labels.description: Ready to merge - mergifyio bot will add the PR to merge queue when all checks pass

body:
## Describe your changes

Closes #4203.

This PR modifies adds a new method on the `Tx` type to remove duplicated sections. This function is then called in the signing function before producing the wrapper signature (which is computed on all the sections) and the `dump_tx` function (in case the dumped tx needed to be signed offline).

To support this logic the `PartialEq` implementation for the `Authorization` type is now manually provided and ignores the way the signer is specified, focusing instead on the targets and the actual signature.

As a side note, also the `PartialEq` implementation for `SigningTxData` has been updated to account for the shielded hash.

## Checklist before merging

body:
## Describe your changes

fixes namada_node release that is not able to access namada_apps manifest as it's not in its build tree:

```
error: failed to run custom build command for `namada_apps_lib v0.47.1`
note: To improve backtraces for build dependencies, set the CARGO_PROFILE_DEV_BUILD_OVERRIDE_DEBUG=true environment variable to enable debug information generation.

Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `/namada/target/package/namada_node-0.47.1/target/debug/build/namada_apps_lib-5075df52883ad4e6/build-script-build` (exit status: 101)
  --- stdout
  cargo:rerun-if-changed=../../.git
```

The build script is moved into the apps crate to use its own manifest and hence avoid this issue

title: Do not exchange balance amounts when querying non-native token balances. (backport #4291)

labels.name: merge
labels.description: Ready to merge - mergifyio bot will add the PR to merge queue when all checks pass

body:
## Describe your changes
When querying the shielded balance of a non-native token, the Namada client currently applies conversions before displaying the result. This is unnecessary because applying conversions should only impact the native token balance, and never the balance of non-native tokens. Therefore this PR skips the balance exchanging step in the case of non-native tokens.

title: Utilize leftover dust in conversions. (backport #4287)

labels.name: merge
labels.description: Ready to merge - mergifyio bot will add the PR to merge queue when all checks pass

body:
## Describe your changes
An attempt to address the reported bug where users' MASP balances are potentially underestimated. This bug is caused by `compute_exchanged_amount` not attempting to consolidate dust and apply conversions on that. This PR attempts to address this issue by always bringing relevant dust back into `input` before attempting a conversion. Under the assumption that the ledger's current epoch does not change during applying conversions, this code algorithm should terminate because:
* If no conversions at all apply to the consolidated amount (i.e the principal plus the dust), then the consolidated amount is simply moved to `output` (so that output is greater than before) progressing the loop in the process
* If a conversion does apply, then the consolidated amount is converted into something "better" and the dust left from this conversion is left in `output` again. Hence the (one-way) conversion progresses the loop.

## Checklist before merging

title: Utilize leftover dust in conversions.

labels.name: merge
labels.description: Ready to merge - mergifyio bot will add the PR to merge queue when all checks pass

labels.name: backport-libs-0.251
labels.description: Backport libraries to 0.251 maintenance branch

body:
## Describe your changes
An attempt to address the reported bug where users' MASP balances are potentially underestimated. This bug is caused by `compute_exchanged_amount` not attempting to consolidate dust and apply conversions on that. This PR attempts to address this issue by always bringing relevant dust back into `input` before attempting a conversion. Under the assumption that the ledger's current epoch does not change during applying conversions, this code algorithm should terminate because:
* If no conversions at all apply to the consolidated amount (i.e the principal plus the dust), then the consolidated amount is simply moved to `output` (so that output is greater than before) progressing the loop in the process
* If a conversion does apply, then the consolidated amount is converted into something "better" and the dust left from this conversion is left in `output` again. Hence the (one-way) conversion progresses the loop.

## Checklist before merging

title: Make modified ZIP 32 derivations the default.

labels.name: merge
labels.description: Ready to merge - mergifyio bot will add the PR to merge queue when all checks pass

body:
## Describe your changes
Closes #4248 . Change the default algorithm for generating shielded keys from pure ZIP 32 to modified ZIP 32. This change in defaults is being made to reduce the chances of confusion arising from the same mnemonic generating different shielded keys - something that's likely to happen since the Namadillo web client uses modified ZIP 32 by default and the hardware wallet only supports modified ZIP 32.

This PR should not be merged before approval is obtained from cryptographers regarding the safety of modified ZIP 32 (i.e. of combining SLIP 10 and pure ZIP 32 in the manner used by the `namadaw derive` subcommand).

title: Support IBC signing on hardware wallets not supporting MASP

labels.name: merge
labels.description: Ready to merge - mergifyio bot will add the PR to merge queue when all checks pass

body:
## Describe your changes
Pure IBC transaction signing currently fails on the Ledger Nano S. This is because it tries to use the hardware wallet to generate MASP build parameters even when they are not needed. This PR modifies the code to ignore MASP build parameter generation failures if they turn out to not be needed for the construction of an IBC transaction.

An alternative approach to this PR could be to determine the precise conditions under which MASP build parameters would be required, and only do generation in those circumstances. This also would work fine, but would involve making sure that the determined conditions do not fall out of sync with the transaction building code that follows its usage.

title: Avoid duplicated signatures when building transactions

labels.name: merge
labels.description: Ready to merge - mergifyio bot will add the PR to merge queue when all checks pass

labels.name: breaking:SDK
labels.description: SDK breaking change

labels.name: backport-libs-0.251
labels.description: Backport libraries to 0.251 maintenance branch

body:
## Describe your changes

Closes #4203.

This PR modifies adds a new method on the `Tx` type to remove duplicated sections. This function is then called in the signing function before producing the wrapper signature (which is computed on all the sections) and the `dump_tx` function (in case the dumped tx needed to be signed offline).

To support this logic the `PartialEq` implementation for the `Authorization` type is now manually provided and ignores the way the signer is specified, focusing instead on the targets and the actual signature.

As a side note, also the `PartialEq` implementation for `SigningTxData` has been updated to account for the shielded hash.

Avoid batching transactions when doing hardware wallet signing because it does not yet support them. Instead sign each transaction separately. Also remove the usage of `--use-device` flags in the test code wherever they are not supported by the CLI. Also resolved https://github.com/anoma/namada/pull/3797#issuecomment-2391356816 regarding informing the user about the requests being made to the hardware wallet.
